title: Why is the music industry sometimes called the business of music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Music industry is the processing and protection of created and distributed music and the people who do that work. The business of music 1. the work of executives to get music in different platforms to generated royalties for the creator of that music and that creator’s company; 2. the support of the music industry. Being in the industry is more like you are grinding every day to get the work done. But the business of music is not about the grind, but the final product and how it gets to the consumer for their enjoyment. That’s the way i’ve seen it in my time doing business in the industry! Hope this is helpful! Markd

response.answer_text: The early music industry was dominated by Electric and Musical Industries (EMI) a company with a history in Industry of manufacturing gramophones In today’s digital world the manufacturing of listening devices is done by tech companies such as Apple and since the demise of the manufacture of records and CD’s the music companies focus in today’s digital world is on the “business of music rights” and no longer based on the manufacturing industry
